content.body:
Australia, USA, Europe, etc.
I got this idea primarily after reading https://www.eff.org/deeplinks/2024/12/australia-banning-kids-social-media-does-more-harm-good
But of course there's more:
US: https://apnews.com/article/senate-child-online-safety-vote-f27c329679feb2d74787fc3887aa710f
EU: https://digital-strategy.ec.europa.eu/en/policies/online-privacy
Netherlands: https://www.security.nl/posting/870014/
France: https://www.twobirds.com/en/insights/2024/france/la-loi-sren-et-la-protection-des-mineurs

content.body: Perhaps [WICG](https://wicg.io/) is a better venue for this than WhatWG, and in general I would start with finding notable organizations who share this idea, not necessarily directly from the small community of people who build browsers (which is who you'd find in this channel).
content.formatted_body: Perhaps WICG is a better venue for this than WhatWG, and in general I would start with finding notable organizations who share this idea, not necessarily directly from the small community of people who build browsers (which is who you'd find in this channel).

I have no particular comment about the idea itself.
